column2: NORTH DAKOTA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column6: ND

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the left.
column6: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car that is traveling faster.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column6: Side Road

column2: 3. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 4. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 5. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: brake suddenly carefully.
column8: use your emergency or parking brake.
column10: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 6. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.

column2: 7. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column6: on the right.

column2: 8. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column8: must turn into its right lane.
column10: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 9. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column6: slow down at the traffic signal.
column10: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 10. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column8: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column10: stop, look right, then left, then right again.

column2: 11. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Immediately come to a complete stop
column6: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: Flagger ahead

column2: 13. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column6: apply the brake and slow down.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: You must make a complete stop
column6: Slow down or stop
column10: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 15. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.
column6: react as you would with a blowout.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.
column10: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.

column2: 16. Who is most at risk?
column6: Experienced drivers.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column10: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 17. You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
column4: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrians.
column6: claim your right-of-way and proceed with caution.
column8: stop to let pedestrians cross safely.

column2: 18. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 19. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Exit

column2: 21. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
column4: pedestrians are crossing at an intersection without a traffic light and without a crosswalk.
column6: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.
column10: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.

column2: 22. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column6: red, yellow and green

column2: 23. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column8: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 24. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 25. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
